description: From Old French lier (“to bind”), from Latin ligare (“to bind, to tie”).

adjectives.description: liable (comparative more liable, superlative most liable)

entries.meaning: bound or obliged in law or equity; responsible; answerable.
examples: The surety is liable for the debt of his principal.
This crime is liable to imprisonment for life.
A man liable to heart disease.

entries.meaning: exposed to a certain contingency or causality, more or less probable.
(as predicate, with "to" and an infinitive) likely.
examples: Someone is liable to slip on your icy sidewalk.
